en: The use case is how we reduced one pipeline processing from 6h to 1.5h and improved reliability by using best practices for processing (e.g. iterative), using Spark and improving how we integrate processing and orchestration code for easier testing. And a quick overview how the process could be even better with DBT.

titles.*: Orchestration of pipelines on large amounts of data: the good, the bad and the ugly

en: Flaky tests may cause plenty of headache to the engineers. Tests that passed just yesterday are now failing all of a sudden. No one chaned anything. It's just the wrong moon phase. It's just the matrix playing jokes on you. Novices just re-run the build, but real pros look into very gist of the problem. Each investigation unfolds a real crime scene. Sometimes it takes years.

I'll show some flaky tests from real projects and most importantly - how the truth could have been found there. Dedicated to automation and software engineers. To everyone who's into software testing and hard problems.

Tiit will look into evolution of testing as discipline and what might be there in future. Software testing has become integral part of development already long time ago but changes in approaches are becoming more frequent and involve growing need for technical skills and is moving towards production vs pre-release testing.

Good application logs make debugging issues much easier, but they come with limitations. The usual human-readable prose is hard to parse, search, and correlate. Weâ€™ll look at how structured logs and JSON output make your life easier, get metrics straight out of the logs, and see how Veriff's automation team is using it all in practice.

There is a wonder-drug, that makes you live longer, enhances your memory and creativity; makes you more attractive, slimmer and lowers food cravings. It also protects you from cancer and dementia, wards off colds, lowers your risk of strokes and heart disease. On top of that - this particular drug makes you more more happy, less depressed and less anxious. Want some?

Veriff was started in 2015, but the first BI analyst didnâ€™t join until the end of 2018. Over the last year, weâ€™ve taken huge strides in becoming more data-driven. Now we have a dedicated team of four analysts and data scientists working on empowering Veriff with data. Hereâ€™s how we did it, and some of the things we learned on the way.
It's 2019, and IaC is not a new term at all. But it's still not an easy thing. In this talk we will go through a couple of easy steps that can help in your DevOps journey ðŸ˜‰.
